trans-unit.source: Provides a fast, read-only, in-memory representation of an XML document by using the XPath data model.

For more information about processing XML data by using the XPath data model, see the [Process XML Data Using the XPath Data Model](~/docs/standard/data/xml/process-xml-data-using-the-xpath-data-model.md) topic.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> class from the XML data in the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> object that contains the XML data.
An error was encountered in the XML data.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> remains empty.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> object passed as a parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> class from the XML data that is contained in the specified <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> object.
After the <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object has been used to load XML data, the cursor of the <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object is positioned at the end of the data.
The <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object must be reset to read through the data again.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> object that contains the XML data.
An error was encountered in the XML data.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> remains empty.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> object passed as a parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> class from the XML data in the specified file.
To preserve white space, use the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor that accepts an <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object as a parameter.
The path of the file that contains the XML data.
An error was encountered in the XML data.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> remains empty.
The file path parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> class from the XML data that is contained in the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object can be used to load a whole XML document or part of an XML document into an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>.
To load part of an XML document into an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>, position the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object on the top XML node to load data from.
When you create an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument> by using the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor, data is loaded from the current top node through all its siblings.
Afterwards, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is positioned on the outer scope of the top XML node.
Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadSubtree%2A> method to load the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument> into a particular element in the XML document.
The following are important notes to consider when you use the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object with the appropriate associated <xref:System.Xml.XmlResolver> object settings can be used to resolve entities or other references in XML data.

If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is positioned on a leaf node that is not valid for the root level of a document—for example, a white space or attribute node—the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object continues to read until it is positioned on a node that can be used for the root.
The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument> begins loading at this point.
To preserve white space, use the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor that accepts an <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object as a parameter.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object that contains the XML data.
An error was encountered in the XML data.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> remains empty.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object passed as a parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> class from the XML data in the file specified with the white space handling specified.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object passed as a parameter specifies whether to preserve white space.
<xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace.Default> preserves only significant white space; <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace.Preserve> preserves all white space.
By default, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object is set to <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace.Default>.

The functionality of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor is identical to that of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor, except for the white space handling options described.
The path of the file that contains the XML data.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> object.
An error was encountered in the XML data.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> remains empty.
The file path parameter or <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> object parameter is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> class from the XML data that is contained in the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object with the specified white space handling.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object passed as a parameter specifies whether to preserve white space.
<xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace.Default> preserves only significant white space; <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace.Preserve> preserves all white space.
By default, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object is set to <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace.Default>.

The functionality of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor is identical to that of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor, except for the white space handling options described.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object that contains the XML data.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> object.
An error was encountered in the XML data.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref> remains empty.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object parameter or <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSpace"></xref> object parameter is `null`.
Initializes a read-only <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> object for navigating through nodes in this <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> is positioned on the root element of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>.
If there is no root element, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> is positioned on the first element in the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>.
A read-only <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> object.
